doc.str: A surfactant with which fine bubbles are easily obtained and which has the high effect of stably maintaining the fine bubbles for long. The surfactant for fine-bubble formation is characterized in that it comprises a (poly)oxyalkylene adduct (A) of a compound (a) containing one or more active hydrogen atoms, the adduct (A) being represented by the following general formula (1), and that a 0.02 wt.% aqueous solution of the adduct (A) has a frothing power of 50 mm or less as measured at 20°C in the Ross-Miles test. Z-[(AO)n-H]p (1) (In the formula, Z is a residue formed by removing the active hydrogen atom(s) from an active-hydrogen-atom-containing compound (a) having a valence of p; A is C1-8 alkylene; n is an integer of 1-400; and p is an integer of 1-100.)
SANYO CHEMICAL INDUSTRIES LTD. | MITSUBISHI ELECTRIC CORPORATION | SUZUKI, KAZUMITSU | MATSUOKA, MASAHIRO | UEYAMA, SATOSHI | MIYAMOTO, MAKOTO
